message.content:
cs.DC, cs.PL, cs.PF, cs.SE, cs.LG. 

The paper discusses the development of hpxMP, an implementation of the OpenMP standard that utilizes the underlying AMT system to schedule and manage tasks. This work involves both parallel programming and runtime systems, which are typically covered in the Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) and Programming Languages (cs.PL) sub-categories. The paper also discusses the performance of hpxMP compared to Clang's OpenMP library on linear algebra benchmarks, which falls under the Performance (cs.PF) sub-category. Additionally, the paper addresses the challenges of porting legacy applications to AMT systems, which is a software engineering concern covered in the Software Engineering (cs.SE) sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the adoption of higher-level interfaces in standards conforming runtime systems, which is a topic covered in the Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-category.
